info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 7:51AM CDT until May 27 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
East Fork Trinity River At McKinney affecting Collin County.
Elm Fork Trinity River Near Carrollton affecting Dallas County.
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County.
...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Texas...
White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Fork Trinity River at McKinney.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will begin along the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING
